title: Here's what's new to Hulu in November 2021 — and what's leaving
text:
The “anti-historical” satire “The Great” (Nov. 19) returns for its second season, with Gillian Anderson joining the cast as the mother of Catherine the Great (Elle Fanning), who seize the Russian throne from her husband, Peter (Nicholas Hoult), and tries to spread the Enlightenment to her country.

Padma Lakshmi is also back with “Taste the Nation: Holiday Edition” (Nov. 4), a four-episode special, exploring the American food traditions of Thanksgiving, Hanukkah, Nochebuena (Christmas Eve) and Seollal (Lunar New Year).

UPDATED: Disney DIS-controlled Hulu also has “The Informant: Fear and Faith in the Heartland” (Nov. 1), an ABC News documentary from George Stephanopoulos about a foiled militia terrorist attack against Muslim immigrants in the Midwest; a new season of the animated reboot “Animaniacs” (Nov. 5); “The Curse of Von Dutch” (Nov. 18), a docuseries examining the rise and fall of the trendy 2000s fashion brand; “Pig” (Nov. 26), starring Nicholas Cage as a reclusive truffle hunter who tracks down the people who stole his prize pig; and a ton of made-for-TV holiday movies, largely coming in one big content dump Nov. 15.

Also see: What's coming in November to Netflix | Amazon Prime Video

Among non-holiday movies, there's “Fargo,” “I, Tonya,” “Inception” and “The Matrix” trilogy (Nov. 1), as well as “Star Trek: Into Darkness” (Nov. 15), “The Boss Baby 2: Family Business” (Nov. 15), and Paul Thomas Anderson's “The Master” (Nov. 16), among many others.

Here's everything that's coming and going, as of Oct. 24 (release dates are subject to change):
